fields.description:
There are times when Jira administrators have to find that which groups are associated with which project permission and roles, to review the access level and remove unwanted group's access.

Currently, the only way to achieve this is to manually visit each permission scheme and the People section of each project and collect the details.

A report/view having the said details will be quite helpful.
fields.summary: Report containing Group association with roles and projects

fields.description:
In project pages under team-managed project, the current site's Confluence space/page can be linked.

Implement the ability to allow the Conference site's spaces to be linked through application links or any other method.
fields.summary: Allow a different Confluence instance to be connected on project pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When transitioning a ticket using time tracking as Days, Jira returns a 500 error.
 !image-2021-10-21-10-16-37-519.png|width=587,height=329!

It will occur whenever the "remaining time" estimate in the issue cannot be converted evenly from number of seconds to the current formatting and then back to whole minutes.

i.e. The remaining time estimate renders as 0.06d, which when converted back to seconds doesn't divide evenly into minutes
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In time tracking menu (<sitname>/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin.jspa) set the config for "Time display format" to "Days" and the "Default unit for time tracking" to minutes.
 # Pick an issue in the site and set the remaining time estimate on it to 29min or 0.06d
 # Ensure that the workflow for this ticket has a status transition with a screen which includes the time tracking field
 # Attempt to transition the relevant issue, setting a "time logged" to 1m

h3. Expected Results

It's expected that when logging time to an issue, you should be able to transition the ticket without any issues, even if the user is using time remaining format in Days.
h3. Actual Results

Jira returns a 500 error once you transition the issue.
As a result there are error logs in the Back-end saying: "Error occurred while converting time estimates:Durations must be in whole minutes"
h3. Workaround

1. The workaround is to switch the site's formatting to "Pretty" in <sitname>/secure/admin/TimeTrackingAdmin.jspa
 OR 
 2. ensure the remaining time estimate when rendered as a fraction of a day always converts evenly to whole minutes (so 0.1d instead of 0.06)
fields.summary: When transitioning a ticket using time tracking as Days, Jira returns a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When implementing the property(jira.permission.edit.group) in status, it seems that we are still able to edit the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a workflow
 # Click on a status and click on properties
 # Add "jira.permission.edit.group" as key and add an existing group
 # Go to an issue and transition to the status that has the property

h3. Expected Results
The issue should be editable only by users of the group specified in the property

h3. Actual Results

Users other than the ones added to the specified group will be able to add comments, link issues, create subtasks, change assignee. Permission granted through the permission scheme overrides the restriction set in the workflow property. Fields like Summary, Description, and other custom fields will not be editable.


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: jira.permission.edit.* property is not working as expected
Unable to edit "remaining Estimate" for the issue using the Rest API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The value entered in the subtask doesn't roll up to the parent issue in
 the Time logging of an issue in Jira for MAC and Jira Mobile.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enter the Time spent under Time tracking in a subtask of a parent issue
 # Refresh the page, and open the parent issue.
 # Check for the Time tracking value in the Parent task and it does not show the time spent/logged on the subtask issue.

h3. Expected Results

Once we enter the Time spent on a subtask issue, the value should add up in the Parent issue Time tracking value.
h3. Actual Results

The time spent on subtask does not add up to the Parent issue Time Tracking value
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: The value entered in the subtask doesn't roll up to the parent issue in the Time logging of an issue in Jira for MAC and Jira Mobile.

fields.description:
Currently, it's not possible to disable the Quick start purple dialogs.
Even though you can dismiss them so they don't appear anymore for your user, it would be nice to have the ability to disable any new ones that might appear or this feature as a whole to all users from the site.

 !image-2021-10-20-22-47-46-028.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Ability to disable Quickstart

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Ability to customise which browser the link opens from in the Jira Native apps
fields.summary: Customise which browser is opened from links in the Jira Mobile apps

fields.description:
Currently ProForma User Fields in JSM do not behave the same as Jira User Fields.  Specifically, customers cannot look up other customers even if they have the Browse Users permission.  This is a documented deficiency in the ProForma documentation.

Now that ProForma is in-house, it would be great for Atlassian to resolve this and allow the ProForma User Field to behave the same as a Jira User Field.

https://docs.thinktilt.com/proforma/ProForma-User-Lookup-Fields.1571291698.html
fields.summary: Improve ProForma User Picker behavior on JSM portal pages

fields.description:
When you have configured different workflows for each issue type in company-managed projects, the bulk edit operation does not show issue types from different workflows when selecting changing issue type.

This action can be done if you use the bulk move operation instead but it would be helpful if a warning is displayed indicating this limitation from the bulk edit operation.
fields.summary: Add an error or warning message in the bulk edit issue type option when issue types have different workflow

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you have more than 6 attachments in a single issue of Jira and click on the attachment to view it, you will get an arrow on the side to cycle through the attachments, however, upon reaching the 6th attachment the arrow to go to the next batch of attachment doesn't appear.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a ticket with more than 6 attachments.
# Click on the attachment.
# Cycle through the using the arrow on the sides.

h3. Expected Results

You would be able to click on an attachment and cycle through all the attachments inside that same ticket.

h3. Actual Results

After cycling through the first 6 attachments, you won't be able to cycle further, unless you exit the screen and click on the 7th then you can repeat the process.

!test32.png|thumbnail! 

 !test_attachment.png|thumbnail! 

h2. Notes

This might be happening because the attachments are paginated in groups of 6 files.

 !Screen Shot 2021-10-20 at 17.53.58.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Only by existing and clicking on the second group of attachments, you will be able to cycle through the next set of attachments.
fields.summary: When doing preview of attachment in a Jira issue only the first 6 attachment can be viwed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on Save as on an owned filter displays a misleading message.

Once the user accesses the filter, there is a *Save as* button and when clicked on it, a message is displayed stating that:
{code}
This filter was created by <your user>. You can save a copy of this filter but you cannot modify the original.
{code}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter
 # Access it once again
 # Click on *Save as* without changing anything on the search

h3. Expected Results
As the user accessing is the owner, the message should not say that *you cannot modify the original.*

h3. Actual Results
Message states that *you cannot modify the original.*

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Clicking on Save as on an owned filter displays a misleading message

fields.description:
within the Product access page, if there are long group naming conventions used the end of the group name will not be visible. Hovering the mouse cursor does not reveal any pop up (tooltip) dialogue to reveal the full name. In my particular scenario, the end of the group is where the vital bit of detail is.

I would like to see at the very least a tool tip appear with the full group name if you hover the mouse over the name. 

Ideally though, the group name should be given space to allow for longer names to be fully visible.

For info, we've got to use a naming convention in our organisation, and these groups are managed by the IDP in our organisation hence why the consistency in those group names

 

!image-2021-10-20-17-08-34-083.png! ard to see which group is added.
fields.summary: Long Group names cannot be read in full within product access page

fields.description: Currently we only see the issue key, which only has the project key + issue key, which is not good enough for understanding which project it belongs specifically when we have multiple projects. it would be great if we can have the work segregated with project title to give a clear picture.
fields.summary: Amend project name in Jira when displaying the task summary of users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JQL searches that include the *issueLinkType* field may not work depending on the amount of issues and links that exist.

h3. Environment
Cloud
- This behavior does not change between the new and old issue view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Although this problem does not occur *always*, it may happen in instances with a considerably high amount of issues (i.e. 300k+ issues).
# To replicate, run a simple search containing the *issueLinkType* field
#* Example: *{{issueLinkType is not EMPTY}}*

h3. Expected Results
Search returns issues that match search criteria
 
h3. Actual Results
An error saying "An unknown error occurred while trying to perform a search."

A failed request with a response code of "JQL too complex" may be returned in the *Browser's console*

h3. Workaround
Limiting the search criteria may be a valid workaround.
* Example: *{{project = <Project A> and issueLinkType is not EMPTY}}*

In case that search does not work, it is possible to try a different approach:
* Create a filter *filter* like: *issueLinkType is EMPTY*;
* Perform the search like the following: *project = <project> AND filter != "filter"*
fields.summary: Issue searches containing "issueLinkType" may not work depending on the amount of existing links

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

double clicking on status name in issue view gives error "*The requested workflow doesn’t exist or is private"*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Click on the status name and take no action
 # Step 2 Now click again on the status name
 # Step 3 You would see the rrror : "*The requested workflow doesn’t exist or is private"*

h3. Expected Results

Transition list should appear without any issue
h3. Actual Results

Transition list does appear but an error pops up as well.
*!image-2021-10-20-16-00-43-946.png|width=266,height=187!*
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page or just click on the transition name to transit the issue. It is important to mention that the transitions are not impaired and can be done normally even if the error pops up.
fields.summary: subsequent clicking on status name in issue view gives error "The requested workflow doesn’t exist or is private"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Automation rule to support Advanced JSON editing with Wikimarkup
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an Automation rule with Advanced JSON editing.
 # In the Advanced JSON file, The only values that one could update about a Table is the following but customers want to be able to update fields like "*isNumberColumnEnabled*" but unable to do so due to the limitation.

h3. Expected Results

We would like to be able to update the value for "*isNumberColumnEnabled*" using the Advanced JSON in Automation but it throws an error as WikiMark does not support all the fields.
h3. Actual Results

Advanced JSON in Automation is able to create the table using *[supported wiki fields|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=tables]*.
h3. Workaround

Create the table using the Automation and then change the table to "NumberedColumn" from the UI.
fields.summary: Automation to support Advanced JSON editing with Wikimarkup

fields.description:
We would like to have a feature to restore from trash/archive kind for the below scenarios.

- Recently, we have encountered many support cases where the dashboard gets deleted when a user leaves a company due to the site access revocation/user removal from the site.
- We are also seeing issues due to an accidental deletion for dashboards/shared dashboards.
- We do not have an log traces generated if some users deleted a shared dashboard from *Settings* > *System* > *Shared items* > *Dashboard* so even if the deletion happens at customer end, we are unable to proeve the same and customer asks for retrieval in such cases if we cant find the actual user who performed this action.
fields.summary: Ability to restore dashboard via a Trash/Archive

fields.description:
Even though the Epic Link should not be editable from the Field Configuration page the customer could benefit if we have the ability to make it required to ensure all the issues created have a parent Epic. It would be similar to the example below:

 

!image-2021-10-19-18-14-55-110.png!
fields.summary: Ability to make the Epic Link field Required

fields.description:
Currently it's not possible to add help tips for custom fields.
It would be nice to have such ability.
fields.summary: Allow help tips for custom fields - alt text and pop-ups

fields.description:
It's great that Jira Automation allows teams to configure outgoing webhooks as an action, but it is very likely these outgoing calls will need authentication, stored as a header.

Customers would like to know these authorization headers are not stored in plaintext, but rather encrypted or hashed on their way to the database.

  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Encrypt or Hash outgoing webhook headers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you hit enter right after an Issue Key that issue key will not be transformed into a link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On the description or a comment enter an issue key and hit enter to write something on the line below

h3. Expected Results
The issue key should be made into a link to the issue

h3. Actual Results
The issue key stays as a simple text

h3. Workaround

Placing a space after the issue key before hitting enter.
fields.summary: Hitting enter after an Issue Key will not transform it into a link

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Select list custom fields have a search designed to bring results that match both the option id or value. The problem happens when the value of the option already contains an identifier number set by the user, so for example, searching for 0201 will not only bring the value that contains this number, but also another value where the 0201 sequence exists on the id of the option. See the example below:

Searching by 0201 brought two results:
 !image-2021-10-19-12-51-30-832.png|thumbnail!

The first result (0150) has the 1*0201* id, causing the search to bring it as a result as well:
 !image-2021-10-19-12-50-27-325.png|thumbnail!
h3. Suggested Solution

Give the admin the ability to disable searching values by id at at custom field configuration level.
fields.summary: Disable search by option id on select list custom fields

fields.description: As a trigger for Jira automation
fields.summary: Support Origianl Estimate field in the "Field Value changed"

fields.description: Most of the time we see that people @mention people in the comments but there is no way to track @mention which are not responded to. One way can be for someone to select a text in the comment and if it has @mention use that to open the create issue screen prepopulated with subject and assignee. once that issue is created, reference to that is automatically added in to the comment.
fields.summary: Track @mention tasks or Quick create issues from within Comments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While creating the Bug in a project, one of the custom fields is not showing correctly
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # When creating custom field as field type User Picker (Multiple users).
 # Typing the name ‘CC’ List for that custom field.
 # Create Issue View while creating the Bug issue type

h3. Expected Results

The custom field should be shown as created before with that name ‘CC’ List
h3. Actual Results

The custom field is not showing the special characters.
 !Screenshot 1.png|width=248,height=195!
h3. Workaround

The CC List will display the same while creating the bug ticket if you remove a single quote from the custom field (From 'CC' List to CC List). 
 !Screenshot 2.png|width=265,height=209!
fields.summary: Apostrophes in Custom Field names are displayed as ASCII code

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The API returning the search results when adding a field to a workflow condition is hard coded to 20 and if an instance has more than 20 matching results there is a possibility that the field is not shown on the list. 

*API used to get matching fields*

https://<InstanceURL>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/field/search?query=<SEARCH-QUERY>&maxResults=20&orderBy=name&expand=key 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create multiple(more than 20) custom fields on an instance eg ( Type, Test type, Test type1, Test type2 .....)
 # On a workflow, condition try to add the custom field by searching *Type*
 # There is a possibility that the custom field would not be shown as there would be more than 20 custom fields matching the search term.

h3. Expected Results

When adding a custom field to a workflow condition all custom fields matching the search criteria should be shown or the results should be paginated/ be infinite scrolling.
h3. Actual Results

Only 20 matching results are shown on the screen. 
h3. Workaround

The only known workaround is to rename the field so that a search could return a unique value or result in less than 20 results.
fields.summary: Unable to see a custom field when adding a field to a workflow condition if there are more than 20 matching results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When an automation rule includes actions for the parent issue key, (normally relates to subtasks) then the automation fails because the parent key is not retrieved by the automation.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an automation rule with the *For Parent* branch like the below example.

!image-2021-10-19-11-58-38-163.png!
h3. Expected Results

No error found, and the automation rule runs successfully.
h3. Actual Results

In Audit Log, *some errors* are thrown:
h5. _{color:#00875a}[Branch rule / related issues|https://upstartnetwork.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.codebarrel.addons.automation/cb-jira-automation-rules#!/rule/2470039/64744959]{color}_

_{color:#00875a}Error searching for related issues. This is most likely because the following issues don't have a related issue of the type you specified. Try narrowing your search to only include issues that contain links to related issues:{color}_

_{color:#00875a}IssueKey-xxxx: "(key =) AND (project in (xxxx))" - Error in JQL Query: Expecting either a value, list or function but got ')'. You must surround ')' in quotation marks to use it as a value. (line 1, character 7){color}_
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When an automation rule includes actions for parent issue key, automation fails with  Error in JQL Query: Expecting either a value, list or function but got ')'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Custom fields of the type *Domain of Reporter* from JSM are not searchable through JQL.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field of the type Domain of Reporter
# Add it to a JSM request or issue screen

h3. Expected Results
The field should appear in JQL searches

h3. Actual Results
The following errors are received:
* Field 'field name' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
h4. Issue Summary
Currently, Jira only supports 100 years back in the Data/Time custom field and if one enters the date beyond 100 years, Jira will automatically convert the year to the future.
For example: 
If the user enters 18 Jan 1928, upon refresh, it will change to 18 Jan 2028.

h4. Workaround
No known workaround is possible at this moment.
fields.summary: Ability to support the date older than 100 years in Data/Time custom field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Clicking Download link on MP4 filetype attachment does not allow users to download

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach MP4 filetype attachment
# Get the download link "https://URL.atlassian.net/secure/attachment/<ID>/Screen+Recording+2021-10-05+at+05.55.03+PM.mp4"
# Paste this URL in the description of other issue key
# Click the link to download

h3. Expected Results
It should prompt users to download it

h3. Actual Results

It doesn't allow users to download the file.

h3. Workaround

Add the *&dl=true* parameter to the generated media URL (https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/<some code)>*&dl=true*
fields.summary: Clicking Download link on MP4 filetype does not allow users to download

fields.description:
The ability to customise the notification emails that are automatically sent when a user requests site access. This will enable administrators to provide any further instructions that need to be followed as per their business process when requesting site access. 

Similarly, the option to either embed a URL or automatically redirect users to another URL upon submitting a request would also achieve alignment with customer business process.
fields.summary: Enable customisation of site access request notification emails.

fields.description:

Disable the help panel suggesting the time tracking format from the log work screen
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Press *Work log* or the *Time tracking* field in order to log work
 # The help panel suggesting the format will be presented every single time
 !image-2021-10-18-16-55-26-750.png|width=134,height=97!

Introduce an option to disable the help panel
h3. Actual Results

There is no current option/workaround to disable it

fields.description:

We are currently not able to use all custom field types in the business project List view filters. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new custom field type  User Picker (multiple users) and associate it to a business project screen;
 # Check to see if the field is available in the List view filters(fields);

!CAB - User Picker (multiple users).png!

!CAB_not listed.png!

The field won't be listed, only custom fields with User Picker (single user) can be added to the List view filters.
h3. Actual Results

Only User Picker (single user) can be listed in the Business List view filters. When a User Picker (multiple users) was added to the project field configuration, it was not accessible in the List view filters.

!User Picker (single user).png!

!CF_in_List_View_filter.png!
{noformat}
 {noformat}

The is no known workaround at the moment.

spacing should work irrespective

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Microsoft Exchange as mail server, messages are being deleted even though IMAP is used. The incoming mail documentation mentions the following:
{code:java}
If Jira successfully processes a message, Jira deletes the message from your mail account (on a POP) or file system (i.e. for file system messages). On an IMAP mail server processed messages are not deleted but marked as read. {code}
Microsoft Exchange uses IMAP by default, so messages should not be deleted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure a mail server with Microsoft Exchange
 # Apply this mail server in one incoming mail handler
 # Send an email message to the address used in mail server
 # You can see that in inbox the message is deleted instead of just being marked as read

h3. Expected Results

When using IMAP, messages should not be deleted, only marked as read. Microsoft Exchange uses IMAP as default, with no option to use POP, so messages should be kept.

Note: this works as expected in mail handler for Jira Service Management, the message is only marked as read.
h3. Actual Results

The messages are being deleted in the mail server.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: When using Microsoft Exchange as mail server, messages are being deleted even though IMAP is used

fields.description:

This happens both for *Default Text Renderer* and *Wiki Style Renderer*.

Refer to the screenshot below. In the screenshot, *Short Text-Test* has *Wiki Style Renderer* and *Paragraph-Test* has *Default Text Renderer*.

There should be an option to disable this feature so that the Issue key is displayed as text only.

JQL example: level changed TO hight

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Removed user can still be mentioned on an issue user commented on

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* create a user
* get the user to comment / add attachment
* remove the user from site
→ You can still mention the user on the issue
→ You would not be able to mention the user on other issues that he has not commented on

h3. Expected Results
Removed user should not be in the @mention list

h3. Actual Results
Removed user is in the @mention list for that particular issue

(i) User is removed from site so notification will not be sent. Hovering over the user will indicate that the user is an invalid user. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Removed user can still be mentioned on an issue user commented on

fields.description:
*Problem Statement:* To Prompt user when a specific value is selected in the field.

*Requirement summary:*

Need an option to display a prompt on screen to show a message when a specific value is selected in the field.

*Example*: Field type is a "Select List (single choice)" with many options in list. "Others" is one of the value. 

When any user select "Other" from the list, they should get a prompt on screen with message to specify their choice in "text" field. 

This is just one example. Customer may need to display this under different scenarios. 

*Workaround :* None available
fields.summary: To Prompt user when a specific value is selected in the field.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The Story Points field is editable despite the field being removed from the edit issue screen
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Exclude Story Points from the edit issue screen but have it on the issue view screen – The field is still editable
 # Exclude another custom field from the edit issue screen but have it on the issue view screen – the field is not editable

h3. Expected Results

The same behavior as other custom fields. I.e if the field is on the issue view screen but not on the edit issue screen, then the field should be visible (for as long as it has a value) but not editable.
h3. Actual Results

The field is still editable despite the edit issue screen not containing it.
h3. Workaround

No workaround
fields.summary: Story Points field editable despite it not being present on the edit issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Default Issue Type Scheme becomes corrupted in the database while updating the scheme. Users will not be able to create new issues or access the existing issues in the projects using the Default Issue Type Scheme.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # The exact steps to reproduce the issue are unknown. Editing the Default Issue type scheme results in this behavior.

h3. Expected Results

Can create Issues like usual.
h3. Actual Results

Cannot create Issues. The Issue Type Scheme name will be shown as ${issueTypeScheme.name} in the Project settings. 
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

An attempt to change the Issue type scheme will result in a 500-Internal Server Error.
h3. Workaround

Please reach out to support to apply the fix.
fields.summary: Unable to create issues after editing the Default IssueType Scheme
Ability to calculate Workratio with decimal values.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary- 

Customers open Jira ticket to which they will be adding excel doc with new/updated data. Each time they have to constantly upload new excel document to an existing jira issue.


Suggestion: Ability to add dynamic files/live files so that they do not need to upload the file every time after making changes to file.
h3. Workaround

We can try to use Google Doc, where live changes will be possible. And then you can attach the link to the Description so that everyone can access it.
fields.summary: Ability to have dynamic or live files as attachment when uploaded from customer portal.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, Manage watcher list permission allows people to add or remove people from an issue’s watch list.

However, if the user is not granted with Manage watcher list permission, they will be still able to add themselves as watchers to the issues.
h3. Suggested Solution

Ability to restrict users from adding themselves as Watcher for the issue.
h3. Why this is important

If the requirement is to only have a specific group of people who manage the watcher list permission to manage the watcher list then If the user is not granted with manage watcher list permission they should not be able to add themselves as watchers to the issue.
fields.summary: Restrict users from adding themselves as Watchers

fields.description:
Once a user logs out/de-authorize the *Jira for Slack* app in Jira, the app keeps on sending messages to user giving suggestions on the app and the integration. Refer to the screenshot.

It is suggested to make the Jira bot not send any suggestions/messages once the user has stoped using it.
fields.summary: Messages from Jira for Slack app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you do a Jira site import the timestamp for attachments showing in the issue view, represents the date when you perform the migration, however, if you switch to the list view you can see the original date when the attachment was uploaded to the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a backup server or Cloud.
# Perform a Jira site import

h3. Expected Results

The timestamp in both views would represent the date when that attachment was first uploaded to the issue

h3. Actual Results

The date in the attachment panel does not match the date in the history, showing the data when the file was uploaded to the Media Services instead.

*Regular issue view:*

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-26 at 15.30.41.png|thumbnail! 

*List view for attachments:*

 !Screen Shot 2021-03-26 at 15.30.32.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. However, it is possible to check the dates when the file was created in Jira in two ways:
* Check the history tab in the issue and locate when the attachment was added or;
* Check the attachment panel in the old issue view using the following URL:
{code:java}
https://<instance>.atlassian.net/browse/<issue_key>?oldIssueView=true{code}
fields.summary: Timestamp in the new issue view doesn't represent the original upload date for an attachment

fields.description: Realized recently that the JRACLOUD project and associated cloud projects are hosted on a Jira Data Center stack, instead of in a cloud instance. It might be beneficial for Atlassian to learn limitations of the product by using it for their own work.
fields.summary: Recommendation to the Atlassian team to use Jira Cloud to manage their backlog.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On create issue dialog when pasting screenshot (or file) from clipboard to description field only text that refers to the image is inserted but no actual file is attached to issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click to create an issue
 # Paste attachments from the clipboard
 # It displays that the image has been attached and Jira doesn't block the ticket creation when the upload in progress
 # The issue is created and the description shows the error *Failed to load* where the files couldn't be attached

Video: [^Screen Recording 2021-10-12 at 01.44.02 PM.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

It should upload the attachments and block the issue creation while the upload progress doesn't finish, then display it on the description as a thumbnail.
h3. Actual Results

It doesn't upload the attachments and the description shows that it can't render the image.

Checking the new issue view, we can see the thumbnail and the message: (!) Failed to load - [example with one attached image and one error|https://gabi-test.atlassian.net/browse/PUB-6]

!image-2021-10-12-13-52-59-370.png|width=261,height=278!  

By clicking on the image:
{code:java}
Something went wrong.
We couldn't generate a preview for this file.
The selected item was not found on the list.{code}
By checking on the old issue view: [example with one attached image and one error|https://gabi-test.atlassian.net/browse/PUB-6?oldIssueView=true&oldissueView=true]
{code:java}
Unable to render embedded object: File (xxxxx.png) not found.
{code}
h3. Workaround

Upload the attachment by using the browse option at upload section at issue creation. This way, Jira does not allow you to create the ticket if the attachment hasn't been uploaded.
h4. Suggested Solutions

Jira should upload the attachments and block the issue creation while the upload progress doesn't finish and display it on the description as a thumbnail.
fields.summary: Copy/paste images on create issue dialog allows to create the issue without the attachment

fields.description:
h2. Summary

As an admin, we ned to ability to create issue layout schemes that allow us to share layouts across projects (JSW and JSW).

 
h2. Suggestion

Add layout schemes.
fields.summary: Ability to create issue layout scheme to share layouts with projects

fields.description:

Similar to JRACLOUD-71630, our users would like to have the possibility to share new issue layout to other JSM projects.
There is currently no possibility in JSM projects to share the new issue layout to other projects.

Hi

I would like notifications in the bell icon on the top right to be customizable.

Yatish

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have an info panel with “\” character within it and then you set up a transition screen, the ADF → wiki markup conversion will add an extra “\”. When users then save the wiki markup, the change will be reflected on the adf rich text field.

An unexpected behaviour when using a custom field(Text field-multi-line).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Adding a value to a field custom field(Text field-multi-line);
 # Using the value in the "info panel" inside the field;
 # After transitioning the issue and resolving it the content of the field where it has "/" gets duplicated. 

!image-2021-10-12-15-47-36-601.png!

!image-2021-10-12-15-47-36-541.png!

 

!image-2021-10-12-15-47-36-680.png!

 

!image-2021-10-12-15-47-36-404.png!
h3. Expected Results

The text value in the field should be the same after transitioning the issue. No changes should be made to the content of the field by transitioning the issue.
h3. Actual Results

When updating the field using an "info panel" inside the field and using "/" in the text and resolving the issue, the forward-slash "/" gets duplicated. 
 *  [^adf to wiki transformation.mov]

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wiki markup transformation adds extra "\" within info panel

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we have Confluence Cloud subscription with a JIRA Software Free one, in case the landing product is set to Confluence and the JIRA site is suspended, the landing product won't work as it is expected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure you have a Confluence Cloud standard and JIRA Software Free subscriptions;
# Navigate to *Site Administration > Product Access* and [set Confluence as the landing product|https://support.atlassian.com/organization-administration/docs/set-your-sites-landing-product/];
# Get the JIRA subscription suspended
# Acces your site URL without {{.../wiki}}

h3. Expected Results
You are redirected to Confluence.

h3. Actual Results
You land in JIRA - as it is suspended, you face a site deactivated message.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Landing product failing if there is a suspended product in the subscription

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When selecting the "Open Link in Jira" option on Safari, the ticket will open in a date picker on the Mac app if one is open.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Download Jira for Mac application
 # Access your Jira on both the Mac application and Safari
 # Open a ticket and a date picker on your Jira for Mac app
 # Select a ticket on your Safari Jira and select a ticket
 # Select the option "Open Link in Jira" on Safari 
 # The ticket will be opened on the Mac app inside the date picker

h3. Expected Results

It's expected that the ticket will open on a separate pop-up
 !image-2021-10-11-15-49-21-513.png|width=482,height=433!

 
h3. Actual Results

The ticket will open inside the date picker.
 !image-2021-10-11-15-49-45-421.png|width=482,height=433!
h3. Workaround

Close any pop-up you have on your Jira for Mac app before using the "Open Link in Jira" option.
fields.summary: When selecting "Open Link in Jira" option on Safari, the ticket will open in a date picker on the Mac app

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In a team-managed project, if you edit a status name in the workflow editor and include a numeral followed by a period '.', it breaks any further editing of the status name.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit the workflow in a team-managed project
 # Edit a statuses name to include the '1. ' characters at the start
 # Save the workflow changes
 # Edit the workflow again and attempt to edit the status name once again

h3. Expected Results

Status name can be edited.
h3. Actual Results

The below error is thrown and you're kicked out of the workflow editor to the issue type settings page.
 [^image-2021-10-07-14-49-49-912.png]
The behavior is rather specific as well, you can start the status name with just a number or even just a '.' character but if you specify both at the start of the status name string then it breaks any further editing of the status name.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Prepending a Status Name with a Numeral and a Period Breaks Further Editing

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Cannot search for a user in the Assignee field using their email address.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ensure the user has Assignable user permission
# Ensure you've Browser Users and groups, Assign issues permission
# Search for the user with the email address in the Assignee field.

h3. Expected Results
The user account should populate

h3. Actual Results
You'll see an option to invite the user.

h3. Workaround
Search for the user with the Display name.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's not possible to select an option for Fix Versions field in Create Issue event as also in bulk edition feature.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

In creation event:
 # Make sure Fix Versions is part of Create Issue screen in Project Settings > Screens
 # Set Fix Versions as a required field through Project Settings > Fields
 # Try to create an issue and set a Fix Version in Create Issue screen

h3. Expected Results

The options for this field should be shown.
h3. Actual Results

No options are shown and the field is presenting as a thin box, not being able to select a value. If Fix versions is set as required, this blocks issue creation.

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

Having a *Epic link* field with same feature as in Company Managaed project is advisable as it not only increases the usability of the TM projects, it also removes confusion.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an automation rule is throttled (for example: Due to high rule processing time), the trigger issue information is not included in the associated items section of the automation audit logs.

h3. Suggestion
It would be helpful to log the issue key while the automation rule has been throttled in order to manually perform the actions on these issues.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the same project, the change issue type option takes to the "Move Issue" dialog instead of changing it directly

h3. Steps to Reproduce

The issue is not reproducible in all scenarios. During the change of issue type from one to another, it moves to the *Move Issue* dialog and shows the field/fields as a mandatory one where it is not possible to set a mandatory field with the Next-Gen S/W project.

h3. Expected Results

The change should happen in the same as this is requested in the same project.
 !Screenshot 2021-09-27 at 18.32.27.png!

h3. Actual Results

Change issue type opens the "*Move Issue*" dialog as it is the designed behavior when we move an issue from one project to another 

!Screenshot 2021-09-27 at 18.29.34.png!
h3. Workaround

As this is not a blocker, the operation can be performed either by specifying a value to the field or selecting the option "*Retain*" to proceed with the change.

!Screenshot 2021-09-27 at 18.30.15.png!
fields.summary: Changing the issue type from one to another in a Next-Gen project opens the "Move Issue" dialog

fields.description:

When Moving Issues from one project to another, Version picker (single or multiple) Custom Fields are not automatically mapped as the system ones (*Affects versions* & *Fix versions*)

 # Create a Version picker (single or multiple) Custom Field & add it to two projects
 # Create a Version with the same name in those two projects

!image-2021-10-08-12-31-34-778.png|width=602,height=189!

fields.description:
Users use tables to work with data in multiple issues text fields, this work includes update propagation which means that when one table is updated other related tables should be updated, currently, this needs to be done manually as there is no way to configure it to be done automatically.

Would be helpful to add a link tables feature where one updates the other linked tables.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Statement:

When using the advanced search in Jira, fields that should be restricted to Team-managed projects are being available to be chosen. This causes some issues especially when they have the same name as global fields.
h3. Suggested Solution:

Team-managed fields should be restricted and visible only across team-managed projects. It should only be visible if the filter is applied to a team-managed project to where this field belongs to.
h3. Why this is important

Making team-managed fields visible across the instance isn't a good user experience as:
 * Team Managed projects are simple and all its settings should be kept inside it
 * In case a field from a TM project has the same name as a global one, it'd be hard to identify which one the search is referring to.
fields.summary: Hide Team Managed fields from Advanced Search

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The activity streams gadget may not show the most recent activity for a given Jira Instance. The activity stream should reflect the issue order when sorting by updated. This can be done by using the advanced issue search to find the following jql: 

{{ORDER BY updated DESC}}
h3. Expected Results

All activity stream entries should be ordered by their last updated activity.
h3. Actual Results

The activity stream entries will reflect the order found using the JQL above but may not contain the newest activities
h3. Possible workaround

Filter out the offending projects which have incorrect activity updates.
fields.summary: Activity streams gadget does not show the latest comments made on issues

Automation for Jira sends out emails from its automation rule even if Jira's Global Configuration is configured to disable Outgoing emails from the instance.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Team-managed and Company-managaed projects work differently. Team-managed projects cannot share resources with other projects, specially when it come to fields.

You can end up having a field in a Team-managed project with the same name of a global field (used by Company-managed projects). Currently, that seems to cause inconsitencies in the search results.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

Consider the following scenario:

* Create a field called *Select list*
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-07 at 10.54.55.png|thumbnail! 
* Create a field of the same type and name in a team-managed project
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-07 at 10.56.21.png|thumbnail! 
* Create an issue *RU-113* in a Company-managed project, and populate the field *Select list*
* Move that issue to a Team-managed project, but do not populate any value for the field *Select list* that belongs to that project:
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-07 at 11.09.39.png|thumbnail! 
** The new key of that issue in my case is *N1-93*

*Scenario 1* Now, let's check the search results:
* Create an issue in that same Team-managed project, populating the field *Select list* present on it
* The UI suggests only one field named after *Select list*
* Search for both the issue you moved to the Team-managed project and the one you have created
* Add the column *Select list* (only one is offered) in the search results

*Scenario 2:*
* Perform a REST API call with the search endpoint, expanding both fields in the results
* In my case, the global field's ID is *10143*, and the Team-managed one is *10225*
{code}
https://unlimitedjiraworks.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/search?jql=key%20%3D%20N1-93&fields=customfield_10143,%20customfield_10225
{code}

h3. Expected Results

*Scenario 1:*
* Only the issue you have created along with a value for the field in the project should display a value in the colum *Select list*

*Scenario 2:*
* Only the field with ID *10225* should be considered for the results since that's in the project's scope

h3. Actual Results

*Scenario 1*:
* Both issues display a value for the field *Select list*. The problem is that in this case the issue that was moved to the project (N1-93) is pointing to the value it had in the global field *Select list* (that's because the value is still stored in the database)
 !Screen Shot 2021-10-07 at 11.39.50.png|thumbnail! 

*Scenario 2:*
* You are able to expand both fields, and a value from the global field will be returned in the issue from a team-managed project (again, because that value is in the database):
{code}
{"expand":"names,schema","startAt":0,"maxResults":50,"total":1,"issues":[{"expand":"operations,versionedRepresentations,editmeta,changelog,renderedFields","id":"57361","self":"https://unlimitedjiraworks.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/issue/57361","key":"N1-93","fields":{"customfield_10225":null,"customfield_10143":{"self":"https://unlimitedjiraworks.atlassian.net/rest/api/2/customFieldOption/10346","value":"A","id":"10346"}}}]}
{code}
* That's a problem if customers need to fill in information in reports and end up adding values that don't really belong to the issues anymore

h3. Workaround

If you need to use REST API and are receiving misleading results from the calls, you will need to make it so you perform calls using the specific IDs of each field.

Also, something that might help identifying the correct fields is by using the [Get fields|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-issue-fields/#api-rest-api-3-field-get] endpoint. Fields that belong to team-managed project have information such as *type:Project* on their values under the *scope* property:
{code}
{"id":"customfield_10225",
"key":"customfield_10225",
"name":"Select list",
"untranslatedName":"Select list",
"custom":true,
"orderable":true,
"navigable":true,
"searchable":true,
"clauseNames":["cf[10225]",
"Select list",
"Select list[Dropdown]"],
"scope":{
     "type":"PROJECT",
     "project":{"id":"10029"}},
    "schema":{"type":"option","custom":"com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.customfieldtypes:select","customId":10225}}
{code}
fields.summary: Fields with same name between team-managed and company-managed projects cause inconsistencies on search results

fields.description:
*Problem Statement : Completing a cross-project Sprint creates confusion when Incomplete Issues exists.*

*Description:* When a sprint is used among different projects, if we try to complete it and there are issues which are incomplete, no matter what option we choose, all issues belonging to different projects will move to backlog. However issues belonging to project from where we are completing sprint goes to the chosen option - next sprint, selected sprint or backlog. 

This adds an extra step where issues from remaining projects needs to be assigned to required sprint again. 

*Details:*

Below an example has been used:
{noformat}
Projects = Project A and Project B

Issues = Issue 1 (in project A) and Issue 2 (in project B)

Active sprint in project A = Sprint-A 1

Next sprint in project A = Sprint-A 2

Next Sprint in project B = Sprint-B 3{noformat}
*Example 1*

Issue 1 and 2 are part of *Sprint-A 1*. When we complete sprint from board of *project* A, we will options to :

a) Move issues to next print : This will move +Issue 1 to Sprint-A 3+ and +Issue 2 to backlog+

b) Move issues to "Sprint-A 2" : This will move +Issue 1 to Sprint-A-2+ and +Issue 2 to backlog+

c) Move issues to backlog: will move all cases to backlogs of *respective projects*. 

*Example 2* 

Issue 1 and 2 are part of *Sprint-A 1*. When we complete sprint from board of *project B*, we will options to :

a) Move issues to next print : This will move +Issue 1 to backlog+ and +Issue 2 to Sprint-B 4+

b) Move issues to "Sprint-B 3" : This will move +Issue 1 to backlog+ and +Issue 2 to Sprint-B 3+

c) Move issues to backlog: will move all cases to backlogs of *respective projects*. 

*Current Behaviour :* This behaviour seems to be *by design*. When we complete sprints, in option we will get sprints which belong to the same project from where we are completing it. And whatever option we choose, it will apply only to native issues and the issues belonging to other project will always move to backlog.

*Requirement:* All issues from all projects should move to the sprint or backlog as selected while completing Sprint. 

 
{noformat}
 Similar behaviour is observed when we have same project but different boards and same sprint is used among all boards.{noformat}
When we use different boards with different board filters, in that case similar behaviour is observed. 

Ex: *Board A* and *Issue A* (*Task* ) and *Issue*(*Bug*) while *Board B* has filter which only displays Bug so on board we see only Bug and no Task. 

Here if we complete sprint from Board B, it will show 2 incomplete issues. And say we choose to move issues to next sprint, it will only move Issue B (which was visible on it) to next sprint. Issue A which was visible on board A will be moved back to backlog.
fields.summary: Completing a cross-project Sprint creates confusion when Incomplete Issues exists.

fields.description:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The JQL  order-by clause that sorts by the number-of-comments custom field produces wrong order,  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create the Custom Field of the type "Number of Comments" and add this  custom field to the appropiate screen to be able to use it in the JQL. 
 Example name of the custom field can be: "my_number_of_comments"

 # Create couple of issues. Add some comments to the issues. Make some of the comments 'restricted  to given group' and some of the comments normal ones.
!image-2021-10-07-16-20-55-391.png|width=380,height=457!
 # Go to JQL search and enter the JQL:

{code:java}
order by my-number-of-comments{code}
!image-2021-10-07-16-07-35-017.png|width=652,height=77!

4. Add "my-number-of-comments" column to the ouput list

5. Alternatively - use rest API JQL search to execute the search:
{code:java}
https://atl-vertigo--jira-jira-branch-mszymandera--5555.jira-dev.com/rest/api/3/search?jql=ORDER%20BY%20cf%5B10031%5D%20asc&fields=customfield_10031 
{code}
h3. Expected Results

The list is sorted by "my-number-of-comments" 
h3. Actual Results

The list is *not* sorted by "my-number-of-comments"

{"expand":"schema,names","startAt":0,"maxResults":50,"total":8,"issues":[ {"expand":"id":"10001","key":"ACC-1","fields":{"customfield_10031":"0.0"}}, {"expand":"id":"10005","key":"REW-5","fields":{"customfield_10031":"1.0"}}, {"expand":"id":"10002","key":"REW-2","fields":{"customfield_10031":"1.0"}}, {"expand":"id":"10004","key":"REW-4","fields":{"customfield_10031":"2.0"}}, {"expand":"id":"10006","key":"ACC-2","fields":{"customfield_10031":"6.0"}}, {"expand":"id":"10003","key":"REW-3","fields":{"customfield_10031":"3.0"}}, {"expand":"id":"10007","key":"ACC-3","fields":{"customfield_10031":"3.0"}}, {"expand":"id":"10000","key":"REW-1","fields":{"customfield_10031":"4.0"}}]}

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Notification platform adds precedence `bulk` header by default irrespective of the General Settings on a Jira Cloud site
 .
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to General Settings on your Jira Site: secure/admin/ViewApplicationProperties.jspa
 # Click on the Edit Settings option to edit the "Exclude email header
 "Precedence: bulk" option and set it to {color:#00875a}*ON*{color}. (This updates JIRA Notification Platform whether to exclude the 'Precedence: bulk' header on Jira notification emails or not).
 !Screenshot 2021-10-07 at 7.06.31 PM.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

Regardless of the setting being *ON* or *OFF* the precedence 'Bulk' is always set in the outgoing emails from JIRA.
h3. Actual Results

Based on the General Settings, If the Setting is toggled *ON*, then the 'Bulk' precedence should be excluded from the email header, and if it is toggled *OFF* then where appropriate the 'Bulk' precedence should be set on the email header.
h3. Workaround
 * As per recent updates, we have found that changing the "Email Notification Format" to *TEXT* from the Personal Settings page *URL:* secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa can avoid the discrepancy in the email header. However, if it's set to HTML the precedence set under General Setting is not obeyed by the Notification Platform.

There has been recent planning and development happening on this where the product team has decided to move to a different notification platform. This BUG would be fixed as part of our current development plan where we are going to migrate from the notification platform to Atlassian Mail.

We do not have a defined ETA for this, but we will update this ticket when we have more information on the same.
fields.summary: Notification platform adds `bulk` header by default irrespective of the General Settings on Jira Cloud Sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL clause 'status not in' might cause performance issues on searches due to the number of statuses.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have ~1000 statuses in the instance;
 # Create a query, not including just part of them;

h3. Expected Results

The query should return the correct results.
h3. Actual Results

Depending on the number of issues and complexity of the query, the search might timeout.
h3. Workaround

This issue typically happens when we have several Team-Managed projects where multiple statuses will be created per project. Since they are unique and do not share configuration, they will contribute to the number of statuses that will exist in the database.

To prevent the problem, make sure to use statuses IDs in the 'status not in' clause to specify the scope of the search.
fields.summary: JQL clause 'status not in' might cause timeout issues on searches due to the number of statuses

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Parent Link in Field Value Changed trigger, the rule is being triggered even when this field is not set.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a rule using Field Value Changes using Parent Link
 # Add any other components to this rule - a condition / action
 # Create an issue not setting Parent Link to it

You'll notice that the rule is triggered even if we create an issue as Task / Story / Sub-Task, which are types that don't support Parent Link
h3. Expected Results

The rule should only be triggered when Parent Link is set.
h3. Actual Results

The rule is being triggered even when Parent Link is not set.
h3. Workaround
 * To check if Parent Link was set when creating an issue, it's possible to use the following Advanced Compare Condition right after the Issue Created trigger:

!image-2021-10-06-12-50-18-213.png|width=434,height=218! 
  
 * To check if Parent Link was set when an issue was updated, it's possible to use the following Advanced Compare Condition right after the Issue Updated trigger:

!image-2021-10-06-12-59-08-394.png|width=367,height=212!
fields.summary: Rule is being triggered when using Field Value Changed trigger even when this field was not updated

Unable to select Assignable users of *Project* *B* in assignee field while creating new issue  from *Project A* if the user is not a Assignable user in *Project A*

 # Create a Automatin Rule from *Project A* where *User A* is not an assignable user
 # Select the Create Issue Action.
 # When Creating an issue Select *Project B* as the project where *User A* is an assignable user.
 # Notice that User A is not shown in the Assignee dropdown list and only assignable users of *Project A* are shown

h3. Expected Results

Assignable users of *Project B* should be shown in the dropdown instead of assignable users of *Project A*
h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
h3. Summary

For team and company managed projects, when searching for issues using JQL such as:
{code:java}
project = PROJECT_NAME AND (status CHANGED FROM "To Do" OR status = "To Do")
{code}
The results are unreliable.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen project with statuses "To Do", "In Progress" and "Done".
 # Create some issues, and transition some of them around.
 # Run the query: {{project = PROJECT_NAME AND (status CHANGED FROM "To Do" OR status = "To Do")}}

h3. Expected Results
 * All issues in that project should be returned.

h3. Actual Results
 * Only some are returned.

h3. Notes

We primarily see this happening in these scenarios:
* The search doesn't work with team-managed projects
* The search doesn't work well in company-managed projects when there has been a workflow change

In both scenarios, using the status_id instead of the status_name works. This also affects searches performed via the Jira APIs.

h3. Workaround(s)

There are different possibilities:
 # Currently, this bug is affecting the default statuses from the Next-Gen project. So, if you use custom statuses, the search is expected to work.
 # Renaming the columns to something different than the default value returns the issues from the search.
 # Another workaround from [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-Software-questions/BUG-JQL-Unable-to-query-next-gen-project-s-issues-with-status/qaq-p/1319216#M67818]
{quote}There is a workaround mentioned on this bug to search via Status ID rather than name - I've tried it and it seems to work - to do this:

Locate your Next-Gen project's ID:
 # Go to https://<your instance name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/project
 # Locate your Project - use your browser search (Ctrl+F or Cmnd+F) to search via Key or Name
 # Copy your Project's ID

Next locate your status' ID:
 # Go to https://<your instance name>.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/status
 # Search for your Project ID - next to it there will be the statuses with their status IDs. These are usually five digits in length and should start with 10, 100 or similar (depending how many custom statuses are on your instance).
 # Copy the relevant Status ID

You can now search using the ID - eg. "Status was 101323".
{quote}
fields.summary: JQL query search using "status was" returns incorrect unreliable results for Team and Company Managed projects

fields.description:
As of the time of this writing, Custom fields at the system level and Next Gen custom fields have an extreme level of collision with each-other. Search is unable to clearly understand which custom field is intended unless you use the extremely ambiguous cf_id format in JQL searching. This causes the JQL searches to be extremely ugly, or requires teams to coordinate on their use of custom fields.

In order to resolve these issues, I would like to propose the use of Namespaces for custom fields. The idea would be to allow users to refer to custom fields with the following syntax:

projectkey:customfieldname

An example would be like:
ABC:EstimatedCost
or
"BAR:Story Points"
This would allow you to specify from which project you want to get the custom field, and would allow macros and other systems to identify custom fields from Next Gen projects more clearly.

For the globally defined custom fields for Classic projects, you can denote them specifically with this syntax:
:EstimatedCost
or
":Story Points"

This would allow you to specifically refer to the classic custom fields without potentially clashing with the namespace of any projects by key. This also opens the door to the third option of not using the namespace ":" designator.

By using the syntax of today, you could potentially implement "smart masking" where only values that are NOT NULL/ NOT EMPTY are returned allowing for values to be combined into a single column on reports for when the name is the same.

This would make the returned information from searches and other systems (such as Confluence Jira Issue Macro) more intuitive and intelligent while also providing more specificity and not requiring a fundamental restructure of the database systems.
fields.summary: Add Namespaces to custom fields

Some apps such as [QMetry|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215144/qmetry-test-management-for-jira-qtm4j?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] offer the option to see the related test cases and bugs, but they will only be displayed on each issue once you click on those options in the quick-add buttons on each issue individually. 

See the recording:  [^Third-party app frame.mp4] 

h3. Suggestion

Provide an option to have such date be always displayed for users when accessing issues.
fields.summary: Have third-party apps' frames persist on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the users are able to send request apps even if the app is already installed, rejected or if the app can't be effectively added to the site.
h3. Issue Description

Site/Jira admins are receiving app requests for apps that are already installed, apps that were rejected, or apps that cannot be installed, like [Jira Cloud for Google Sheets (Official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1220382/jira-cloud-for-google-sheets-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] for instance. The issue seems to be happening in the JSW onboarding flow.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround to prevent users to send new app requests for these apps. Therefore, for now, to clean up the app requests, the requests can be rejected.
fields.summary: Requesting apps is possible even for installed and rejected apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attempting to open a hyperlink inside an issue collector dialog results in an error in the form.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a custom field to have a hyperlink in its description, for example https//www.google.com:  !image-2021-10-05-23-17-00-691.png|thumbnail! 
# Create a new issue collector and include the custom field with the hyperlink in its description.
# Include the issue collector in a webpage.
# Open the Issue collector dialog from the webpage.
# Attempt to open the hyperlink from the summary:  !image-2021-10-05-23-18-42-760.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The link would open in a new window/tab.

h3. Actual Results
An error is returned "xxx.xxxxxx.xxxx refused to connect."
 !image-2021-10-05-23-19-24-902.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use the command/ctrl + click or use the mouse wheel click to open a new tab instead of attempting to open it normally.
fields.summary: Attempting to open a hyperlink inside an issue collector dialog results in an error in the form

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sorting by Parent in team-managed projects breaks the secondary sorting clause.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter for team-managed project issues containing inside an Epic (containing a parent). JQL: project = TMP
 # Order by parent. JQL: project = TMP ORDER BY parent
 # Add another clause to sort items. JQL: project = TMP ORDER BY parent, assignee

h3. Expected Results
Issues to be ordered by parent and then sub-ordered by assignee.

h3. Actual Results
Issues remain ordered by parent only, no matter the second clause (i.e. assignee ASC, assignee DESC)

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sorting by parent breaks the secondary sorting clause.

fields.description: We would like to have a "soft-delete" option in Jira, where we would change the issue' status for deleted but not excluding them from Jira's database, this could be helpful for data lake applications such as Stitch where if an issue is deleted in Jira, the data in the lake would not be updated after the deletion.
